# ğŸ¢ Enterprise Features Roadmap

> **Note:** These features are NOT in the open source version. They are available exclusively under commercial licensing.

## Current Enterprise Features

### 1. Medical LoRA Adapters
**Status:** In Development (Q1 2026)

Pre-trained adapters for healthcare applications:
- **General Practice:** Common symptoms, triaging
- **Specialist:** Cardiology, Neurology, etc.
- **Emergency:** First aid, crisis management
- **HIPAA-Aware:** Trained to avoid PII exposure

**Pricing:** Included in Enterprise tier

---

### 2. Multi-Tenant Infrastructure
**Status:** Planned (Q2 2026)

SaaS-ready deployment:
- Namespace isolation per tenant
- Resource quotas and billing
- Admin dashboard
- Usage analytics

**Pricing:** Business tier and above

---

### 3. Compliance Modules
**Status:** Planned (Q2 2026)

Regulatory compliance layers:
- **HIPAA:** Healthcare data protection
- **SOC2:** Security controls
- **GDPR:** EU data privacy
- **Audit Logging:** Complete activity trails

**Pricing:** Enterprise tier only

---

### 4. High-Availability Sync
**Status:** Research (Q3 2026)

Production-grade P2P:
- Mesh network topology
- Automatic failover
- Conflict resolution (CRDT)
- Bandwidth optimization

**Pricing:** Enterprise tier

---

### 5. Model Marketplace
**Status:** Concept (2026)

Pre-trained domain adapters:
- Legal
- Finance
- Education
- Customer Support
- Software Engineering

**Pricing:** Ã€ la carte or Enterprise bundle

---

## Why This Model?

**For Open Source Community:**
- âœ… Full access to core technology
- âœ… Build ANY application you want (if open source)
- âœ… Learn from production-grade code
- âœ… Contribute and improve

**For Enterprises:**
- âœ… Skip months of R&D
- âœ… Compliance out-of-the-box
- âœ… Priority support
- âœ… Custom features

**For South West Labs:**
- âœ… Sustainable development
- âœ… Focus on innovation, not consulting
- âœ… Give back to community

---

## Contributing to Enterprise Features

**Can community contribute to enterprise features?**

**Short answer:** No, but you can influence them.

**Long answer:**
- Enterprise features stay proprietary to fund development
- BUT: If community builds similar features, we may open-source enterprise versions
- Your feedback shapes what we build
